dmca.title: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation
dmca.body:
I just received another notice from your organization claiming my email "does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA")." The information provided in this email does, in fact, comply to the letter with every notification element of the DMCA. If your orgainzation refuses to acknowledge and dismisses outright this legitimate complaint, you do so having now been further informed that we will aggressively pursue any and all recourse in regard to our copyrighted materials. Furthermore, any and all accounts our dealings with: Tagslammer.com (70.85.225.213) Blogtorank.com (70.85.225.217) RankingForums.com (70.85.225.215) toranktools.com (70.85.225.196) and ThePlanet.com as their host. will be subject to discussion in our network of over 4 million subscribers as well as any/all of our industry contacts. If indeed, the information below does not meet with your expectations of 'substantial compliance of notification', perhaps you wouldn't mind elaborating a bit on specifically what elements you're looking for. Feel free to contact me with any questions, comments, or concerns in this matter. I'm looking forward to the quick resolution of this issue. Sincerely, -Michael McDonald ---------- Forwarded message ---------- From: mike mcdonald Date: Aug 17, 2006 6:49 PM Subject: Re: FW: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation To: Copyright To Whom It May Concern; Clarification/required elements (as per Section 512(c)(3)): (i)A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. Michael McDonald Operations Manager iEntry, Inc 2549 Richmond Rd 2nd Floor Lexington, KY 40509 (ii)Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed, or, if multiple copyrighted works at a single online site are covered by a single notification, a representative list of such works at that site. http://www.webpronews.com/insiderreports/searchinsider/wpn-49-20060809SES2006SearchEnginesFriendOrFoe.html http://www.webpronews.com/topnews/topnews/wpn-60-20060808PerlPlusJiftyEqualsHiveminder.html (iii)Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to locate the material. http:// bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=2621 http://bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1661 (iv)Information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to contact the complaining party, such as an address, telephone number, and, if available, an electronic mail address at which the complaining party may be contacted. Michael McDonald Operations Manager iEntry, Inc 2549 Richmond Rd 2nd Floor Lexington, KY 40509 Phone: 859-514-2720 Fax: 859-219-9065 email: mike@ientry.com (v)A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law. I have a good faith belief that the use of the material that appears on the service is not authorized by the copyright owner (iEntry, Inc), any agent of iEntry, Inc. , or by operation of law. (vi)A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. The information in this notice is accurate, and I am authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner. That should substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). ThePlanet.com is hosting sites whos sole function is the dissemination and sale of software designed to exploit copyrighted materials. Specifically, this site/software is replacing link structures and/or altering/redirecting links within copyrighted materials. Thank you for your continued attention in this matter. -Michael McDonald On 8/17/06, Copyright < Copyright@theplanet.com> wrote: > > To Whom It May Concern: > > Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not > substantially comply with the required notification elements of the > Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). > > Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your > claim. > > Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal. > > Legal Response Team > THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. > > -----Original Message----- > From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] > Posted At: Thursday, August 17, 2006 12:04 PM > Posted To: Copyright > Conversation: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation > Subject: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation > > > From: abuse@theplanet.com > Subject: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation > Reference: [TP-C505510N] > > For your review. > > Thank you, > > Policy Enforcement > The Planet Internet Services, Inc. > http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ > > ==== Original Message ==== > 1. Copyright Violation > Added by system at Thursday, Aug 17 2006 04:29 pm > X-MailFrom: michaelmcd@gmail.com > X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com > Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for > < abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com>; Thu Aug 17 16:16:42 2006 > Return-path: > Delivery-date: Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:16:42 -0500 > Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by > mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from michaelmcd@gmail.com) with > esmtp (Exim) id 1GDp3C-000HvL-MZ > for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:14 > -0500 > Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by > smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); > Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:14 -0500 > Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] > helo= mx02.filter.theplanet.com) > by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from michaelmcd@gmail.com) > with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) > (Exim) > id 1GDp3C-0004Ks-5a > for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:14 -0500 > Received: from nz-out-0102.google.com ([64.233.162.201]) > by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from > michaelmcd@gmail.com ) > with esmtp (Exim) > id 1GDp3A-00037d-A1 > for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:12 -0500 > Received: by nz-out-0102.google.com with SMTP id m7so416126nzf > for ; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 14:05:11 -0700 (PDT) > DomainKey-Signature: a=rsa-sha1; q=dns; c=nofws; > s=beta; d=gmail.com; > > h=received:message-id:date:from:to:subject:cc:mime-version:content-type; > > > b=JJ5UmEy9UQgF+qxXVitArORgKp7rEZqU7NFDbcCuGVgj6zRbD/JTmVX3Ol+WvHuAXaN2T4 > +gDSrbRo84fPfRoTsEPlgC7r0XEcwTY0qF8xQ24+mpzk5U4qWOPMk4oAAvs+kf1hcMuvov++ > CQ6YR5FdDmnQrm+Hj8GKGSbvkoZBU= > Received: by 10.35.41.14 with SMTP id t14mr4284196pyj; > Thu, 17 Aug 2006 14:03:40 -0700 (PDT) > Received: by 10.35.85.14 with HTTP; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 14:03:40 -0700 > (PDT) > Message-ID: <63a747380608171403ja8fad0bk93389e79586ae060@mail.gmail.com > > Date: Thu, 17 Aug 2006 17:03:40 -0400 > From: "mike mcdonald" > To: abuse@theplanet.com , postmaster@tagslammer.com > Subject: Copyright Violation > Cc: legal@theplanet.com > MIME-Version: 1.0 > Content-Type: multipart/alternative; > boundary="----=_Part_12259_10555704.1155848620406" > Received-SPF: pass (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: domain of gmail.com > designates 64.233.162.201 as permitted sender) client-ip=64.233.162.201; > envelope-from=michaelmcd@gmail.com ; helo=nz-out-0102.google.com; > X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Aug 2006 21:05:14.0269 (UTC) > FILETIME=[D5866CD0:01C6C240] > > (multipart/alternative) > MIME element (text/plain) > Hello, > > I have made multiple attempts to contact the owner/operator of: > > Tagslammer.com (70.85.225.213) > Blogtorank.com (70.85.225.217) > RankingForums.com (70.85.225.215) > toranktools.com ( 70.85.225.196) > > Unfortunatly, my inquiries have been ignored to this point. At issue is > the fact that these URLs are violating one or more terms of the DMCA by > altering and/or misrepresenting copyright protected content. > Specifically, the following URLs are (just a few) examples of content > that has been scraped and had key elements of it's linking structure > altered and or redirected to your client's network. > > bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=2621 > bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1661 > bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1868 > > This practice is in clear violation of your own AUP: > > http://theplanet.com/legal/index.html > > > Specifically the following section: > > "*Intellectual Property Infringement Policy* > > Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or > otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or work > that infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet > has the right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the > extent required under any law or regulation, including the Digital > Millennium Copyright Act of 1998." > Any and all works originating from WebProNews.com or the iEntry network > of sites must either be restored to their oringal state (including any > and all links contained within) or promptly removed. > > > I appreciate your time and attention in this matter. Please feel free > to contact me if you have any further questions. > > Regards, > > Michael McDonald > Operations Manager > iEntry, Inc. > 859-514-2720 > > MIME element (text/html) > Hello,

I have made multiple attempts to contact the > owner/operator of:

href="http://Tagslammer.com">Tagslammer.com    & > nbsp;  (70.85.225.213)
href=" http://Blogtorank.com"> Blogtorank.com     >     ( href="http://70.85.225.217 ">70.85.225.217)
RankingForums.com  > ; ( 70.85.225.215)
href="http://toranktools.com">toranktools.com     > ;     ( > 70.85.225.196)

Unfortunatly, my inquiries have been ignored > to this point.  At issue is the fact that these URLs are violating > one or more terms of the DMCA by altering and/or misrepresenting > copyright protected content.  Specifically, the following URLs are > (just a few) examples of content that has been scraped and had key > elements of it's linking structure altered and or redirected to your > client's network. >

href="http://bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=2621">bookmarks.tagslammer.com/ > ?p=2621
href="http://bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1661"> > bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1661
 href="http://bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1868 ">bookmarks.tagslammer.com/ > ?p=1868
>
This practice is in clear violation of your own AUP:

href="http://theplanet.com/legal/index.html">http://theplanet.com/legal/ > index.html


Specifically the following > section:

" Intellectual Property Infringement > Policy >

Customers > may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or otherwise > store on a Server any information, data, material, or work that > infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet has the > right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the extent > required under any law or regulation, including the Digital Millennium > Copyright Act of 1998."

Any and all works originating from > WebProNews.com or the iEntry network of sites must either be restored to > their oringal state (including any and all links contained within) or > promptly removed. >


I appreciate your time and attention in this matter.  > Please feel free to contact me if you have any further > questions.

Regards,

Michael McDonald
Operations > Manager
iEntry, Inc.
859-514-2720


> > MIME element (text/plain) > >
